back_cards.definition_en: A casual term for a man or guy.
Used to express surprise or emphasis.
Refers to a friend or buddy.
back_cards.example_en: I'm hanging out with my dude later.

back_cards.definition_en: A way to address someone directly.
back_cards.example_en: Dude, you gotta try this pizza.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to show excitement or admiration.

back_cards.example_en: Put the books on the upper shelf.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a higher social or economic class.
back_cards.example_en: She's from the upper crowd in town.
The upper part of the wall is painted blue.

back_cards.definition_en: A drug that stimulates or energizes.
back_cards.example_en: He took an upper to stay awake.
The upper management made the call.

back_cards.definition_en: To cover something by folding material around it.
back_cards.example_en: Can you wrap this sandwich for me?
We need to wrap this project by Friday.

back_cards.definition_en: A type of food rolled in a tortilla.
back_cards.example_en: I got a chicken wrap for lunch.
She wrapped her arms around me.

back_cards.definition_en: To cover or package a gift.
The top executive of a company.
back_cards.example_en: The CEO announced a new product line.
Our CEO is meeting with investors today.
The CEO took responsibility for the error.
The CEO wants us to focus on growth.
She’s the CEO of a tech startup.
The movie had great visual effects.

back_cards.definition_en: Something you can see or picture.
back_cards.example_en: I’m a visual learner, so I need diagrams.
The presentation needs more visual aids.
She’s into visual design and photography.
I have a visual of how this will look.

back_cards.definition_en: A new plan or action to start something.
back_cards.example_en: She took the initiative to start a club.
He showed initiative by solving the issue.

back_cards.definition_en: A first step in a process.
back_cards.example_en: This initiative will help the community.
The city launched a green initiative.
I like her initiative in leading the team.
I gotta rush to catch the bus.

back_cards.definition_en: A feeling of excitement or urgency.
back_cards.example_en: I got a rush from skydiving.
The morning rush at the cafe is crazy.
Don’t rush me, I’m almost ready.
There’s a rush of water in the stream.
Meet me at the front gate.

back_cards.definition_en: A point of access, like at an airport.

back_cards.example_en: They called it the email gate scandal.
The gate opened to let the water out.

back_cards.definition_en: A way to enter or leave a place.
back_cards.example_en: The side gate is always locked.
I smile whenever I see my dog.
We can meet whenever, I’m not busy.
Whenever it rains, the roof leaks.
Call me whenever you need help.
Her entry into the room was dramatic.
The main entry is around the corner.

back_cards.definition_en: A record or note in a list.
back_cards.example_en: I made an entry in my journal.
His entry into politics was surprising.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to Japan or its culture.
back_cards.example_en: I love Japanese food like sushi.
The Japanese are known for politeness.
This Japanese car is super reliable.
The Japanese garden was so peaceful.

back_cards.definition_en: A color between black and white.
back_cards.example_en: I got a gray hoodie yesterday.
It’s been gray and rainy all day.
The rules are in a gray area.
He’s got some gray in his beard.
Her mood was gray after the news.

back_cards.definition_en: Help or support given to someone.
back_cards.example_en: Can you give me some assistance?
I need assistance with this form.
She offered assistance to the new guy.

back_cards.definition_en: How tall something or someone is.
back_cards.example_en: His height is about six feet.
The fire reached its height at noon.
I’m scared of heights, so no cliffs.
The party was at its height by midnight.
The wall’s height is ten feet.

back_cards.definition_en: To strive to win against others.
back_cards.example_en: I’m gonna compete in the race.

back_cards.definition_en: To challenge someone in a contest.
back_cards.example_en: She competes with the best runners.

back_cards.definition_en: To try to be the best.
back_cards.example_en: We compete to get the top score.
They compete for the same job.

back_cards.definition_en: At its core or most important part.
back_cards.example_en: This app is essentially a game.
We’re in the planning phase now.

back_cards.definition_en: A period of time with a specific focus.
back_cards.example_en: She’s going through a rebel phase.
This is just a phase of the project.
His goth phase didn’t last long.

back_cards.definition_en: To get better after illness or injury.
To restore to a previous state.
To heal or improve after a setback.

back_cards.example_en: His criticism of the movie was harsh.
She gave me some fair criticism.

back_cards.definition_en: Pointing out flaws in a plan.
back_cards.example_en: The plan faced a lot of criticism.

back_cards.definition_en: Teachers or staff at a school.
back_cards.example_en: The faculty met to discuss grades.
She has a faculty for math.
His faculties are sharp for his age.
The faculty supports the new policy.
Winning the race was a big achievement.
Her promotion was a huge achievement.
Finishing the book was an achievement.
He got an award for his achievement.
I don’t drink alcohol at all.
This beer has low alcohol content.
They served alcohol at the party.

back_cards.definition_en: A liquid used as a disinfectant.
back_cards.example_en: Use alcohol to clean the cut.

back_cards.definition_en: A way to address emotional issues.

back_cards.example_en: He’s in therapy for his knee.
Therapy taught me a lot about myself.
That’s an offense in this game.
His comment was taken as an offense.
That song is a total killer.
Her outfit was a killer at the party.

back_cards.definition_en: A person’s unique traits or character.

back_cards.example_en: His personality makes him fun to be around.

back_cards.definition_en: The natural scenery of an area.
A view or layout of land.
back_cards.example_en: The landscape changed after the storm.

back_cards.definition_en: A painting or image of scenery.

back_cards.example_en: We hiked through a rugged landscape.

back_cards.definition_en: In a profound or intense way.
back_cards.example_en: I’m deeply sorry for your loss.

back_cards.definition_en: To a great extent or degree.
back_cards.example_en: She’s deeply into that new show.
He cares deeply about the cause.

back_cards.definition_en: In a thorough or detailed way.
back_cards.example_en: We discussed it deeply last night.

back_cards.definition_en: At a deep level or depth.
back_cards.example_en: The issue runs deeply in the community.
That’s a reasonable price for a burger.

back_cards.definition_en: Based on logic or good judgment.

back_cards.example_en: I just want a reasonable solution.
Be reasonable, we can’t do that now.

back_cards.definition_en: To be really bad or disappointing.
To draw something in, like with a vacuum.
back_cards.example_en: The fan sucks in cool air.
It sucks that we lost the game.

back_cards.definition_en: To pull in or absorb something.
back_cards.example_en: This sponge sucks up water fast.

back_cards.definition_en: A change from one state to another.
back_cards.example_en: The transition to college was tough.
We’re in a transition at work.
She’s transitioning to a new job.
The team handled the transition well.
The transition to summer was quick.

back_cards.definition_en: In a just or fair manner.

back_cards.example_en: He treated us fairly during the deal.

back_cards.definition_en: A regular article in a publication.

back_cards.example_en: Check the numbers in that column.

back_cards.definition_en: A group of people or vehicles moving together.
back_cards.example_en: A column of cars passed by.
The column stood tall in the hall.
I need to wash my car.
This shirt needs a good wash.

back_cards.definition_en: A small object to fasten clothes.
back_cards.example_en: This shirt is missing a button.

back_cards.definition_en: A switch or control to activate something.
back_cards.example_en: Press the button to start the game.
She wore a button with a smiley face.

back_cards.definition_en: Something you click on a screen.
back_cards.example_en: Click the red button to submit.

back_cards.definition_en: A way to secure or close something.

back_cards.example_en: My opponent in chess is tough.

back_cards.definition_en: A rival in a game or debate.

back_cards.example_en: He’s an opponent of the new law.

back_cards.definition_en: To flow or cause liquid to flow.
back_cards.example_en: Can you pour me some coffee?
It’s pouring outside, grab an umbrella.

back_cards.definition_en: To serve a drink from a container.
To come or go in large amounts.

back_cards.example_en: Water poured out of the pipe.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who moves to a new country.
back_cards.example_en: My neighbor is an immigrant from Mexico.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone seeking a new life abroad.
back_cards.example_en: The immigrant started a small business.

back_cards.definition_en: A person settling in a foreign land.

back_cards.example_en: She’s an immigrant who loves her new home.
The city welcomes immigrants every year.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of giving or sharing something.
back_cards.example_en: The distribution of food was quick.

back_cards.definition_en: Delivering goods to people or places.
back_cards.example_en: They handle the distribution of books.

back_cards.definition_en: The spread or arrangement of something.
back_cards.example_en: The distribution of wealth is uneven.
We organized the distribution of supplies.
The distribution of tasks was fair.

back_cards.definition_en: A sport played with clubs and a ball.
back_cards.example_en: I’m going to play golf this weekend.

back_cards.definition_en: An activity on a course with holes.
back_cards.example_en: Golf is harder than it looks.

back_cards.definition_en: A game of precision and skill.

back_cards.example_en: My dad loves golf on Sundays.
She’s pregnant with her first child.
My sister’s pregnant and due in June.
Her silence was pregnant with emotion.
The pregnant woman glowed with joy.
I’m unable to come to the party.
He’s unable to fix the car.
She was unable to call back.
They’re unable to meet the deadline.
I’m unable to lift heavy boxes.
I found an alternative route home.
This is a good alternative to sugar.

back_cards.definition_en: An option instead of the usual.

back_cards.example_en: The movie had some violent scenes.
The storm was violent and destructive.
A violent crash closed the road.

back_cards.definition_en: A part or share of something.
back_cards.example_en: I ate a small portion of cake.
This portion is enough for two.

back_cards.definition_en: A piece of a larger whole.
back_cards.example_en: A portion of the funds went to charity.
She got a portion of the profits.
This portion of the book is boring.
I acquired a new phone yesterday.

back_cards.definition_en: To learn or develop a skill.
back_cards.example_en: She acquired Spanish in a year.
They acquired land for the park.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of taking one’s own life.
back_cards.example_en: The news about the suicide was heartbreaking.
Quitting now would be career suicide.

back_cards.definition_en: An act of ending one’s life.

back_cards.example_en: I need to stretch my legs.

back_cards.definition_en: A period or expanse of time.
back_cards.example_en: We worked for a long stretch.
That stretch of road is bumpy.
Her arms stretched across the table.

back_cards.definition_en: A shortfall or lack of something.

back_cards.example_en: The company faced a huge deficit.
We have a deficit in volunteers.
The team’s score showed a deficit.

back_cards.definition_en: A sign of illness or condition.
back_cards.example_en: A fever is a symptom of the flu.
This is a symptom of bad planning.
Her cough is a symptom to watch.
Low sales are a symptom of trouble.

back_cards.definition_en: A clue about a health issue.

back_cards.example_en: We installed solar panels last year.
The solar industry is growing fast.
I filed a complaint about the service.
Her complaint was about the noise.

back_cards.definition_en: A formal report of a problem.

back_cards.example_en: My only complaint is the wait time.

back_cards.definition_en: Having the ability to do something.
back_cards.example_en: She’s capable of fixing the car.
He’s a capable leader at work.
I’m capable of doing this myself.
They’re capable of winning the game.
She’s capable of running the show.
She analyzed the book for class.
We need to analyze the problem.
I’m scared of the dark sometimes.
She’s scared to give the speech.
He was scared during the storm.
I’m scared we’ll miss the flight.
That loud noise really scared me.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone who backs a cause or person.
back_cards.example_en: I’m a supporter of local artists.

back_cards.definition_en: A fan of a team or idea.
back_cards.example_en: She’s a big supporter of the team.
He’s a supporter of the charity.
Supporters rallied for the new law.

back_cards.definition_en: To break up or move earth.
back_cards.example_en: I’m gonna dig a hole in the yard.
I really dig this new song.
Let’s dig into the details later.
Don’t dig your elbow into me.
Do you dig what I’m saying?
I have twenty bucks in my wallet.
The twenties were a wild time.
They scored twenty in the game.

back_cards.definition_en: To act as if something is true.

back_cards.example_en: She pretended to be a princess.

back_cards.definition_en: To fake an emotion or action.
To play a role or character.
To act in a game of make-believe.
back_cards.example_en: Kids love to pretend they’re animals.

back_cards.definition_en: A set of beliefs or principles.
back_cards.example_en: My philosophy is to stay positive.

back_cards.definition_en: The study of ideas and existence.
A way of thinking about life.
back_cards.example_en: His philosophy is live and let live.

back_cards.definition_en: A system of thought or values.
The time when someone is a child.
back_cards.example_en: My childhood was full of adventures.

back_cards.definition_en: The state of being a kid.
back_cards.example_en: I miss the freedom of childhood.
His childhood was spent on a farm.
Lower the volume, it’s too loud.
The lower shelf is easier to reach.

back_cards.definition_en: To reduce in amount or value.
back_cards.example_en: They lowered the price of the car.
He’s in a lower position at work.
Let’s lower our expectations a bit.

back_cards.definition_en: A large amount of money or assets.

back_cards.example_en: This land has a wealth of resources.
He built his wealth over years.
There’s a wealth of info online.
She’s on welfare to support her kids.
The dog’s welfare is my priority.

back_cards.definition_en: The state of being very poor.
A lack of resources or money.
A lawyer who brings charges in court.
back_cards.example_en: The prosecutor argued the case well.

back_cards.definition_en: An attorney in a criminal case.
back_cards.example_en: She’s a tough prosecutor in court.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to the soul or spirit.

back_cards.example_en: The song has a spiritual vibe.
Her spiritual side guides her choices.
I’ll take a double coffee, please.
He’s my double, we look so alike.
We hit a double in baseball.

back_cards.definition_en: To do two things at once.
back_cards.example_en: She doubles as a singer and actor.
She evaluated the car before buying.
We need to evaluate our options.
The boss will evaluate my work.
I’m evaluating which phone to get.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to Israel or its people.

back_cards.example_en: My friend is an Israeli from Tel Aviv.
I love Israeli music and dance.
This is an Israeli wine brand.
The Israeli flag was waving high.
Please reply to my text soon.
Her reply was short and sweet.
I’ll reply to the email later.
She didn’t reply to my call.
I only have five bucks on me.

back_cards.definition_en: A male deer or similar animal.
back_cards.example_en: We saw a buck in the woods.
Don’t buck the system, just follow it.
The horse gave a wild buck.
I need to make a quick buck.

back_cards.definition_en: A tool with a sharp blade.
back_cards.example_en: I need a knife to cut this apple.
He carried a knife for safety.
This knife is great for chopping.

back_cards.definition_en: To stab or cut with a knife.
back_cards.example_en: Be careful not to knife yourself.

back_cards.definition_en: Circular or shaped like a circle.
back_cards.example_en: We sat at a round table.

back_cards.definition_en: A single stage in a competition.
A burst of activity or action.
back_cards.example_en: Let’s do another round of drinks.
She works in tech in Silicon Valley.
The new tech is so advanced.
I love showing off my tech.
She hired a detective to follow him.
He’s a detective with great instincts.

back_cards.definition_en: To put things into a bag.
back_cards.example_en: I need to pack for the trip.

back_cards.definition_en: A group of animals or people.
back_cards.example_en: A pack of wolves ran by.
I bought a pack of gum.
My pack is heavy with books.

back_cards.definition_en: A state of chaos or mess.
back_cards.example_en: The room was in total disorder.

back_cards.definition_en: A living being, often an animal.

back_cards.example_en: He’s a funny creature, isn’t he?

back_cards.definition_en: An animal in a specific context.
back_cards.example_en: Forest creatures were active at night.

back_cards.definition_en: In a careful or detailed way.

back_cards.example_en: They live closely to the park.

back_cards.definition_en: In a tight or connected way.

back_cards.example_en: This is an industrial part of town.
This is an industrial cleaning product.
Housing the homeless is a priority.
There’s a chip in this plate.
The phone has a fast chip.
I love chips with my burger.

back_cards.definition_en: To break off a small piece.
back_cards.example_en: Don’t chip the paint on the wall.
I put my chips on the table.
I’m going, regardless of the rain.
He left, regardless of my advice.
I’m helping regardless of the cost.
I got numerous texts about the party.
She has numerous pairs of shoes.
There are numerous reasons to stay.
The captain gave a clear command.
He’s in command of the ship.
Her command of English is great.
The command moved out at dawn.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of firing a gun.
A violent act with a gun.

back_cards.example_en: I felt a shooting pain in my leg.
I heard a loud pop outside.
The balloon might pop if you poke it.
Can you grab me a pop?
I’ll pop over to the store.
Add a layer of cheese on top.
A layer of dust covered the table.
Layer the clothes in the suitcase.

back_cards.definition_en: A part of a complex system.
A food made from flour and water.

back_cards.example_en: I need to earn some bread.

back_cards.definition_en: A staple food in many cultures.
A loaf or slice of food.

back_cards.example_en: Bread and butter is my go-to.

back_cards.definition_en: Something that doesn’t follow a rule.
back_cards.example_en: She’s the exception to the trend.
This is an exception to our policy.
That’s an exception, not the norm.
I’ll make an exception for you.
Her passion for music is obvious.
He spoke with so much passion.
Their passion for art inspires me.

back_cards.definition_en: Dedication to a hobby or goal.
back_cards.example_en: She pursues her passion every day.

back_cards.definition_en: A major road for long-distance travel.
back_cards.example_en: We took the highway to the city.
This highway leads to the coast.
I got stuck on the highway.
This water is pure and safe.
Her joy was pure and contagious.
I love pure chocolate, no additives.
It was pure luck we won.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone in charge of a group.
back_cards.example_en: She’s the commander of the team.
The commander made a tough call.
The weather was extreme this week.
We hiked to the extreme edge.
That’s an extreme way to diet.
I love extreme sports like bungee jumping.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of making something public.
back_cards.example_en: The publication of the report was delayed.
Publication of the news caused a stir.
She’s the vice president of the club.
The vice captain led the team.
My vice is eating too much candy.
He’s a nice fellow, isn’t he?
He’s a fellow of the science club.

back_cards.definition_en: A friendly term for a person.

back_cards.example_en: The missing keys are a mystery.
Her disappearance is still a mystery.

back_cards.definition_en: A story about solving a crime.
back_cards.example_en: I love a good mystery novel.
That old house is a total mystery.

back_cards.definition_en: A contest to determine a winner.
The title of being a champion.
The act of being the best.

back_cards.example_en: They trained hard for the championship.

back_cards.definition_en: To set up or put in place.

back_cards.example_en: They installed a new AC unit.
She was installed as team captain.
We need to install new shelves.

back_cards.definition_en: To add a program to a device.
back_cards.example_en: Did you install that app yet?
She told a tale about pirates.
Her tale of adventure was epic.
We have the liberty to choose.
The cat hid beneath the couch.
Treasure was buried beneath the sand.
Look beneath the rug for clues.

back_cards.definition_en: A person traveling in a vehicle.
back_cards.example_en: The bus was full of passengers.
I’m just a passenger in this car.

back_cards.definition_en: A traveler on a plane or ship.
A person along for the ride.
A doctor in a specific field.
To complete a course or degree.
back_cards.example_en: I graduate from college next month.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who has a degree.
To move to a higher level.
back_cards.example_en: He graduated to a better job.

back_cards.definition_en: Having a keen edge or point.

back_cards.example_en: I felt a sharp pain in my side.
He looked sharp in that suit.
The image on this TV is sharp.
The substance of her talk was clear.
The substance felt weird to touch.

back_cards.definition_en: The mood or vibe of a place.
back_cards.example_en: The party had a great atmosphere.
This cafe has a cozy atmosphere.
The atmosphere was tense at work.

back_cards.definition_en: To mix something by moving it.
back_cards.example_en: Stir the soup so it doesn’t burn.
Her speech really stirred the crowd.
The leaves stirred in the breeze.
I stirred the batter for the cake.
My friend is a devout Muslim.
She attends a Muslim community center.
Muslims pray five times a day.

back_cards.definition_en: An adherent of the Islamic religion.
back_cards.example_en: He’s proud to be a Muslim.

back_cards.definition_en: A section of text or writing.
back_cards.example_en: I read a passage from the book.
The passage led to a secret room.
The passage of time feels fast.

back_cards.definition_en: A part of a speech or story.

back_cards.example_en: Add some pepper to the soup.
I stuffed the pepper with rice.
She peppered her speech with jokes.
This sauce has a pepper kick.

back_cards.definition_en: A type of bell or chili pepper.
back_cards.example_en: I grow peppers in my garden.
I want to emphasize how important this is.
She emphasized the need for teamwork.
He emphasized his point with examples.
The bridge is held by strong cables.

back_cards.definition_en: A wire for electricity or signals.
back_cards.example_en: I need a new charging cable.
We still have cable at home.

back_cards.definition_en: A bundle of wires for connection.
A shape with four equal sides.
back_cards.example_en: Draw a square on the paper.

back_cards.definition_en: A public open area in a city.
back_cards.example_en: Let’s meet at the town square.
He’s always square with his deals.

back_cards.definition_en: To multiply a number by itself.
A tool for measuring right angles.
back_cards.example_en: Use the square to check the corner.
I found a great pizza recipe.

back_cards.definition_en: A list of ingredients and steps.

back_cards.example_en: Hard work is her recipe for success.
This box is a heavy load.

back_cards.definition_en: To put something into a device.
back_cards.example_en: Load the dishes into the dishwasher.
I’ve got a load of laundry to do.
He loaded the truck with supplies.

back_cards.definition_en: A pile or mass of things.
back_cards.example_en: She’s under a load of stress.

back_cards.definition_en: The top covering of a building.
The upper part of a structure.
back_cards.example_en: Rain was dripping from the roof.
We need a new roof this year.

back_cards.definition_en: Next to or at the side of.
back_cards.example_en: Sit beside me on the couch.
The park is beside the river.
Beside that, we have no issues.
My dog sleeps beside my bed.
We grow vegetables in the garden.
Eat more vegetables, they’re good for you.
This soup is full of vegetables.

back_cards.definition_en: A food like broccoli or spinach.
back_cards.example_en: I need vegetables for the stew.

back_cards.definition_en: To achieve or finish a task.
back_cards.example_en: She accomplished a lot this week.
They accomplished the project on time.
She stayed silent during the argument.
The forest was silent at night.
He gave me a silent nod.
The crowd was silent after the news.
Biting my nails is a bad habit.
She has a habit of arriving late.
Smoking’s a tough habit to quit.
His habit of joking annoys me.
The discovery of gold was huge.
I made a cool discovery today.
The recovery of my phone was a relief.
They used DNA to identify him.
DNA connects us to our ancestors.

back_cards.definition_en: An area of land or region.
A field or domain of activity.
To be made up of something.
back_cards.example_en: The team consists of five players.
The meal consists of soup and salad.
This book consists of ten chapters.
I need proof you were there.
Her ID was proof of age.
The recipe is proof of her skill.
His nervous laugh gave him away.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of leaving a vehicle.
A space for leaving a car.
back_cards.example_en: I found a great parking spot.

back_cards.definition_en: The process of stopping a car.
An area for vehicles to park.

back_cards.example_en: Stealing is a sin in most faiths.

That’s an unusual shirt you’re wearing.
It’s unusual to see snow here.
The taste was unusual but good.

back_cards.definition_en: A staple food in many cultures.

back_cards.example_en: Rice is a major crop here.

back_cards.definition_en: The field of designing and building.
A branch of science and math.

back_cards.example_en: The team advanced to the finals.
Can you advance me some cash?
I buried my face in my hands.

back_cards.definition_en: To lay a body to rest.

back_cards.example_en: This test was a piece of cake.
The tip was from an anonymous source.

back_cards.definition_en: A piece of cloth with symbols.

back_cards.example_en: I flagged the issue for review.
